instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15 inch restarts when trackpad is connected
threads.message:
As the title says, tested in fully working known good top case including the trackpad. 
If the trackpad is connected it starts to boot, shows apple logo and just before it has to show the login screen it restarts.
It is the same with internal SSD, external OS and known good SSD.

Side note, the trackpad does function just fine in the option menu.

I replaced <CHIP>U4820</CHIP> in desperation to see if it's going to change anything but the issue still persists
If I disconnect the trackpad it boots to OS just fine.

Any ideas what this can be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15 inch restarts when trackpad is connected
threads.message:
Test with known good battery.
Does it stay long time on, if you leave it in boot menu?
Only restarts when progress bar appears?
Try SMC bypass and safe mode too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15 inch restarts when trackpad is connected
threads.message:
Only restarts on progress bar yes.

Tested with known good battery.
I will try smc bypass

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15 inch restarts when trackpad is connected
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 15 inch restarts when trackpad is connected
threads.message:
I tried a brand new battery, this time it works.
I have no clue why it didn't work when I tried the other top case with the battery..

Anyway, thanks for the help.
